Backgammon

Class BackgammonGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backgammon.BackgammonGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Game<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>

    public class BackgammonGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements Game<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
    Implements a game of Backgammon.
    Author:
    Andrew Socha

      • getPlayer

        public java.lang.String getPlayer(int playerNum)
        Returns the player corresponding to the specified player number. For efficiency reasons, BackgammonStates use numbers instead of strings to identify players.
        Parameters:
        playerNum - the player number: either 1 or 2
        Returns:
        the player's name

      • getActions

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getActions(BackgammonState state)
        Creates a list of all the actions that the AI considers for a given state
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface Game<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        state - any game state
        Returns:
        A list of valid moves that the AI will consider playing for that game state. To reduce duplicate game states in the AI's search tree, the AI does not consider all valid moves. If there are no valid moves, the list contains only -1.

      • getResult

        public BackgammonState getResult(BackgammonState state,
                                 java.lang.Integer action,
                                 boolean isComputer)
        Clones a state, performs a move on that state, and returns the result. The state must be cloned because the AI analyzes multiple possible moves on the state.
        Parameters:
        state - the initial game state
        action - the location of the disc to be moved: 0-25 indicate game spaces; 50-75 indicate that the game should swap the selected die, then use the associated space in 0-2; -1 indicates no valid move for the AI (the player can use 0-25 for no valid move)
        isComputer - true if the AI is using this method, false if the player is using it
        Returns:
        the resulting game state

      • getResult

        public BackgammonState getResult(BackgammonState state,
                                 java.lang.Integer action)
        Not used, but I'm forced to Override it See public BackgammonState getResult(BackgammonState state, Integer action, boolean isComputer) instead
        Specified by:
        getResult in interface Game<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>

      • isTerminal

        public boolean isTerminal(BackgammonState state)
        Checks if someone has won the game
        Specified by:
        isTerminal in interface Game<BackgammonState,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        state - the current game state
        Returns:
        true if someone has won, false otherwise

      • getUtility

        public double getUtility(BackgammonState state,
                         java.lang.String player)
        Gets the utility of a state for a given player
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        player - either player's name
        Returns:
        the utility value of the state for the player

      • getWinner

        public java.lang.String getWinner(BackgammonState state)
        Gets the winning player of a state. Assumes that one of the players has won (isTerminal() is true).
        Parameters:
        state - any game state
        Returns:
        the name of the winning player
